data.Subject: [Ops] Fwd: ops mailing list

body.plain:
Sorry...

My intention was to send the message to obs@ivoa.net, not to your personal
email :)

Please tell us if you received this email (sent to obs@ivoa.net) and reply
to obs@ivoa.net.

Thanks
Giulia


---------- Forwarded message ----------
From: Giulia Iafrate <giulia.iafrate@gmail.com>
Date: 2015-05-06 14:15 GMT+02:00
Subject: ops mailing list
To: Tom.McGlynn@nasa.gov


Dear Tom,

today I and Marco have done some tests on the obs mailing list and have
registered you with email address "Tom.McGlynn@nasa.gov".

At the moment the only three members are us, so we can do any test.

Please tell us if you receive this email and try to reply to ops@ivoa.net.

p.s. after a check you turn out to be registered to the folloowing lists
with three different email addresses:

Thomas.A.McGlynn@nasa.gov found in:
     obs-tap
     voql
     wgchairs
     semantics
     ivoa-trusted
Tom.McGlynn@nasa.gov found in:
     apps-samp
     ops
thomas.a.mcglynn@nasa.gov found in:
     registry

Do you want to make them uniform? I can move "Thomas.A.McGlynn" and
"thomas.a.mcglynn" to "Tom.McGlynn".


Regards
Giulia

data.Subject: Re: [Ops] ops mailing list

body.plain:
Dear Giulia (and also sent to the ops list),

Looking at your message I was intrigued, because it didn't list the two 
groups under which I've been receiving the bulk of IVOA mail, the DAL 
and DM groups.  Conversely I don't recall getting mail from any of the 
other groups recently.
Nor have I gotten anything from the ops group this morning.

Looking at some of the headers for the mail I have received, I noted 
that it looks like they are actually using
a very old address
    tam@milkyway.gsfc.nasa.gov
which looks from my non-expert reading of the mail headers to be 
translated at Goddard into my standard NASA mail address.

If this is correct, then it looks like what is happening is that no 
email sent by the IVOA list servers is getting to me when it is sent 
using my nominal NASA addresses.  My official address is 
thomas.a.mcglynn@nasa.gov and we're allowed to set up a shorter alias 
which I've made tom.mcglynn@nasa.gov.   My understanding is that E-mail 
names are case insensitive, so it shouldn't matter which of the versions 
you note below are being used.  Indeed it appears that it does not: they 
are all failing!

One quick solution would be to use the tam@milkyway but I'd certainly be 
interested in understanding why the proper address isn't working.  Any 
thoughts?
     Tom


Giulia Iafrate wrote:
> Dear Tom,
>
> today I and Marco have done some tests on the obs mailing list and 
> have registered you with email address "Tom.McGlynn@nasa.gov 
> <mailto:Tom.McGlynn@nasa.gov>".
>
> At the moment the only three members are us, so we can do any test.
>
> Please tell us if you receive this email and try to reply to 
> ops@ivoa.net <mailto:ops@ivoa.net>.
>
> p.s. after a check you turn out to be registered to the folloowing 
> lists with three different email addresses:
>
> Thomas.A.McGlynn@nasa.gov <mailto:Thomas.A.McGlynn@nasa.gov> found in:
>      obs-tap
>      voql
>      wgchairs
>      semantics
>      ivoa-trusted
> Tom.McGlynn@nasa.gov <mailto:Tom.McGlynn@nasa.gov> found in:
>      apps-samp
>      ops
> thomas.a.mcglynn@nasa.gov <mailto:thomas.a.mcglynn@nasa.gov> found in:
>      registry
>
> Do you want to make them uniform? I can move "Thomas.A.McGlynn" and 
> "thomas.a.mcglynn" to "Tom.McGlynn".
>
>
> Regards
> Giulia
>

Hi,
if you receive this mail it means you're successfully enlisted in ops@ivoa.net.

Cheers,
    Marco

Dear Tom,
here is Marco Molinaro (I do some tech work for Giulia related to IVOA
web assets and services).
I'm enlisted in ops@ivoa.net to test the list preparation and
following a bit the email troubles we/you're facing.

Thanks to your further info on your emails I can see (on the mailman lists):

Thomas.A.McGlynn@nasa.gov found in:
     obs-tap
     voql
     wgchairs
     semantics
     ivoa-trusted
Tom.McGlynn@nasa.gov found in:
     apps-samp
     ops
tam@lheapop.gsfc.nasa.gov found in:
     dal
     interop
     dm
     votable
     ivoa-trusted
tam@milkyway.gsfc.nasa.gov found in:
     dal
     interop
     ivoa-trusted
thomas.a.mcglynn@nasa.gov found in:
     registry

So, really, apart from case sensitiveness and 'client' side aliasing,
it seems you have 3 (2? if lheapop and milkyway are the same) mail
addresses sparse on the IVOA lists and duplicating your membership on
dal and interop.

We can easily group you up in one, I suppose that tom.mcglynn@nasa.gov
would be ok; is this ok for you?

One think, on the other hand, that I didn't get is: did you actually
receive the previous mail sent to ops@ivoa.net or only the one
directed specifically to your personal account?
I'll send another mail to ops 'only' to let you check once more (will
send it simultaneously to this one).

Regards
     Marco
